name: Golang
scope: A Go developer with INTERMEDIATE proficiency levels, with 3-6 years of experience, has solid command of Goâ€™s core syntax (slices, maps, structs, interfaces, pointers), concurrency (goroutines, channels, worker pools), and error handling (custom errors, error wrapping). They structure projects with Go modules/packages, follow Go idioms, and leverage design patterns like factory, decorator, or adapter. They write unit/integration tests using the `testing` package, incorporate mocking frameworks, and track coverage metrics with linting tools. They handle day-to-day coding tasks like debugging concurrency issues, managing semantic versioning conflicts, optimizing performance, and preventing race conditions or deadlocks. They use `go mod` for dependency management, create reproducible builds, and integrate with Docker and CI/CD pipelines. They design REST/gRPC services (often using `gorilla/mux`), manage API versioning, and implement basic microservice patterns (pub-sub, message queues). They identify performance bottlenecks using profiling and benchmarking tools (`pprof`, `go test -bench`) and apply caching and concurrency best practices. They handle security concerns (secret management, injection prevention), implement logging frameworks (`zap`, `logrus`), and integrate authentication (JWT, OAuth2). They stay aware of newer features (generics) and maintain familiarity with popular libraries (e.g., `sqlx`, `gorm`) while refining architectural thinking.
